histogram.name: Crostini.AppLaunch
histogram.summary: Recorded each time a Crostini app is launched, recording whether the app is the built in terminal, a registered app, or an unknown app.

histogram.name: Crostini.AppLaunchResult
histogram.summary: The result of attempting to launch a Crostini app (including Terminal).

histogram.name: Crostini.AppsInstalledAtLogin
histogram.summary: Records the number of Crostini apps that surface in the launcher at login time (not including the Terminal). This only logs if Crostini is enabled for the current user.

histogram.name: Crostini.AvailableDiskCancel
histogram.summary: The available disk space at the start of the crostini install flow, recorded when installation was canceled. This is recorded any time the user cancels the install before it finishes. This includes cases where e.g. they previously tried installing and got an error.

histogram.name: Crostini.AvailableDiskError
histogram.summary: The available disk space at the start of the crostini install flow, recorded when installation returned an error. This is recorded any time the user tries to install install crostini and gets an error. This includes cases where e.g. they previously tried installing and got an error.

histogram.name: Crostini.AvailableDiskSuccess
histogram.summary: The available disk space at the start of the crostini install flow, recorded when installation succeeded. This is recorded any time the user successfully installs crostini. This includes cases where e.g. they previously tried installing and got an error.

histogram.name: Crostini.Backup
histogram.summary: Result of crostini backup.

histogram.name: Crostini.BackupCompressedSizeLog2
histogram.summary: log base 2 of compressed container backup size in bytes, rounded to the nearest integer. Value is between 0 and 50, to give good granularity for common sizes, while maintaining a range that can support very large sizes.

histogram.name: Crostini.BackupContainerSizeLog2
histogram.summary: log base 2 of uncompressed container image size in bytes, rounded to the nearest integer. Value is between 0 and 50, to give good granularity for common sizes, while maintaining a range that can support very large sizes.

histogram.name: Crostini.BackupSizeRatio
histogram.summary: 100 * compressed size / container size. The conventional compression ratio of input / output has not been used as the resulting value is unbounded.

histogram.name: Crostini.BackupTimeFailed
histogram.summary: Time taken for failed backup.

histogram.name: Crostini.BackupTimeSuccess
histogram.summary: Time taken for successful backup.

histogram.name: Crostini.ContainerOsVersion
histogram.summary: Recorded each time a Crostini container is launched, recording the OS version running inside the container.

histogram.name: Crostini.Crosvm.CpuPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of the system CPU that crosvm processes used during the 10-minute measuring period. This is recorded once every 10 minutes when crosvm is running.

histogram.name: Crostini.Crosvm.Processes.Count
histogram.summary: The number of crosvm processes that are running at the end of the 10-minute interval. This is recorded once every 10 minutes when crosvm is running.

histogram.name: Crostini.Crosvm.RssPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of the system memory that crosvm processes used at the end of the 10-minute measuring period. This is recorded once every 10 minutes when crosvm is running.

histogram.name: Crostini.DiskResize.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result (e.g. succeeded) whenever an attempt to resize a Crostini disk finishes.

histogram.name: Crostini.DiskResize.Started
histogram.summary: Recorded each time a user tries resizing a Crostini disk to infer attempts that started but never finished (e.g. code bug missing a timeout). This won't exactly line up with the total of Crostini.DiskResizeResult due to how metrics work (e.g. start one day and result the next) but should be close.

histogram.name: Crostini.DiskType
histogram.summary: Records the type (e.g. sparse qcow2) of the user's disk. Emitted often, you probably want to look at the unique user numbers of this metric. Certain disk types are vulnerable to disk corruption in certain scenarios so this metric tracks our progress in moving people off them and tells us if we need to do additional work to migrate users off.

histogram.name: Crostini.FilesystemCorruption
histogram.summary: Filesystem corruption events in the crostini VM, recorded every time corruption is observed to affect the state of the system.

histogram.name: Crostini.RecoverySource
histogram.summary: Recorded each time the CrostiniRecoveryView is show, on detecting that a VM is still running after a Chrome crash.

histogram.name: Crostini.Restarter.Started
histogram.summary: Emitted whenever a run of CrostiniRestarter is triggered except during the initial install.

histogram.name: Crostini.RestarterResult
histogram.summary: The result of a single run of CrostiniRestarter. This is recorded any time the crostini restart flow is triggered, except during the initial install.

histogram.name: Crostini.Restore
histogram.summary: Result of crostini restore.

histogram.name: Crostini.RestoreTimeFailed
histogram.summary: Time taken for failed restore.

histogram.name: Crostini.RestoreTimeSuccess
histogram.summary: Time taken for successful restore.

histogram.name: Crostini.SettingsEvent
histogram.summary: Record user's choice in Crostini Settings

histogram.name: Crostini.Setup.Started
histogram.summary: Emitted whenever a run of CrostiniRestarter is triggered during the initial install.

histogram.name: Crostini.SetupResult
histogram.summary: Recorded each time the user completes the Crostini setup UI, recording the result of the setup.

histogram.name: Crostini.SetupSource
histogram.summary: Recorded each time the user initiates the Crostini setup UI, recording the UI surface that invoked the setup.

histogram.name: Crostini.Stability
histogram.summary: A record of post-startup failures in crostini components. Buckets are recorded to whenever we become aware that the corresponding component has failed.

histogram.name: Crostini.TerminalSettingsChanged
histogram.summary: Record which settings in terminal are changed by users. This is captured each time terminal is launched and fetches the current settings, and not just when settings are changed, in order to give the best information about the current state of active users.

histogram.name: Crostini.TimeFromDeviceSetupToInstall
histogram.summary: The time from a user setting up their device, to the user enabling Crostini.

histogram.name: Crostini.TimeToInstallCancel
histogram.summary: The time taken for the crostini installer to be canceled by the user. This is recorded any time the user cancels the install before it finishes. This includes cases where e.g. they previously tried installing and got an error.

histogram.name: Crostini.TimeToInstallError
histogram.summary: The time taken for the crostini installer to fail due to an error. This is recorded any time the user tries to install install crostini and gets an error. This includes cases where e.g. they previously tried installing and got an error.

histogram.name: Crostini.TimeToInstallSuccess
histogram.summary: The time taken for the crostini installer to finish successfully. This is recorded any time the user successfully installs crostini. This includes cases where e.g. they previously tried installing and got an error.

histogram.name: Crostini.UninstallResult
histogram.summary: Recorded each time the user completes the Crostini uninstall UI, recording the result of the uninstall.

histogram.name: Crostini.UninstallSource
histogram.summary: Recorded each time the user initiates the Crostini uninstall UI, recording the UI surface that initiated the uninstall.

histogram.name: Crostini.UnsupportedNotification.Reason
histogram.summary: Recorded each time we display (or would display, see suffixes) a notification that the user is trying to do something Crostini doesn't support.

histogram.name: Crostini.UpgradeAvailable
histogram.summary: Recorded each time the user sees the Crostini upgrade Notifiation, recording the action that closded the notification.

histogram.name: Crostini.UpgradeDialogEvent
histogram.summary: A collection of events that can occur while upgrading the crostini container, recorded as they occur.

histogram.name: Crostini.UpgradeSource
histogram.summary: Recorded each time the user sees the Crostini upgrade UI, recording the UI surface that initiated the upgrade.
